sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: China's President Xi Jinping has secured a historic third term as the Communist Party's leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Far-right leader Giorgia Maloney has been officially inaugurated as Prime Minister of Italy, making her the country's first woman to take on the role.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The race to become the UK's next Prime Minister heats up as former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak officially declares his candidacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: China's President Xi Jinping is now all but certain to sail through to a third term as the country's leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Re-elected head of the Communist Party and cementing his place as the nation's most influential ruler since Mao Zedong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On behalf of the CPC new central leadership, she says, I wish to thank the whole party sincerely for the trust you have placed in us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We'll keep in mind the party's nature, our own mission and responsibility and work diligently in the performance of our duties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Appointing Xi as its General Secretary for a precedent-breaking five-year term tilts the country decisively back towards one-man rule, after decades of power-sharing among its elites.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The CCP also named a seven-member Politburo Standing Committee led by Xi, an inner circle of power dominated by the party's allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He will be formally announced president during the government's annual legislative sessions in March.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A new era in Italian politics has opened up as Prime Minister Giorgio Maloney joined former PM Mario Drachi at the Palazzo Cigi in Rome for the traditional bell ringing ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The event signifies a handover of power, in this case from a technocrat government to the most far-right coalition since the end of the Second World War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Maloney is also the first female prime minister in the 76-year-old history of the Italian Republic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: European Union chiefs are wary of the far-right taking power, but say they are ready to cooperate with the new coalition government, while Maloney says she is ready to work with the bloc's leaders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, the new coalition was sworn into power by Italian President Sergio Mattarella.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Although Malone's post-fascist Brothers of Italy party won the recent election, in order to govern they need the support of former Premier Silvio Berlusconi's Forza Italia and the far-right League led by Matteo Silvini.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Former UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak has officially confirmed he will run in the Conservative Party leadership contest in what will be his second shot in three months of becoming Prime Minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Sunak, who reportedly has the support of over 120 MPs, said in a tweet that he would work to fix the economy and unite a fractured Tory party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Former Prime Minister Boris Johnson looks likely to be Sunak's main challenger. He's yet to formally join the race, but close allies claim he already has enough support to make the ballot. British media has reported that Sunak held talks with Johnson on Saturday, fuelling speculation the pair could strike a deal to unite the party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Former Cabinet Minister Penny Morden was the first candidate to declare her leadership bid on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She fell just short of making the final two in the previous leadership election, despite receiving strong support from colleagues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Candidates must secure 100 nominations by Monday afternoon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: If two or more reach that threshold, lawmakers will vote to eliminate one and hold an indicative vote on the final two.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian officials said on Saturday that two people were killed and 12 wounded by a Ukrainian shelling in the town of Shebekyno in the Belgorod region close to the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The regional health minister said one of the dead was a 14-year-old boy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The town has now started building protective structures, according to the local governor, who posted images on social media. in the south pro-russian authorities in hirson are continuing to urge residents to leave in the face of kiev's advancing counter-offensive observers expect fierce clashes to take place in and around the city as both sides battle for control on the ukrainian side the air force said critical infrastructure across the country was pounded by Russian missiles on Saturday, with several regions reporting strikes on energy facilities and power outages.

sentences.sentence: President Volodymyr Zelensky said the attacks were on a very wide scale.

sentences.sentence: In his nightly address, he called on citizens to cut down their use of electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hungary's national flag was hoisted with military honours in front of parliament in Budapest on Sunday morning, in a state commemoration marking the anniversary of the anti-Soviet revolt which began on 23rd October 1956.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Children explored vehicles which remain intact from 66 years ago, when protests which began as peaceful student-led movements quickly transformed into an armed, country-wide revolution known as the Hungarian Uprising, against the communist dictatorship and the Soviet occupation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Soviet tanks moved onto the streets to restore order. An estimated 2,500 Hungarians died and hundreds of thousands fled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Viktor Orbán addressed crowds in western Hungary. In his speech, Orbán lauded the nationwide resistance efforts, but didn't pass up the opportunity to hit out at those on the left, who he said looked down on people from the countryside and resented the fact commemorations were taking place outside the capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The ceremony was attended by President Katalin Novak, military officials as well as members of the public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A Russian warplane crashed into a two-story residential building that housed two families in Irkutsk, a city in eastern Siberia. The plane's two crew members were killed in the crash, but there were no casualties on the ground. This is the 11th reported non-combat crash of a Russian warplane since Moscow invaded Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.sentence: Sun, the beach and energy savings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Spanish town of Benidorm in the so-called Costa Blanca has long been a popular destination for people from all over Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But now it is also the place to save on high energy bills, thanks to its mild climate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's cheaper to stay here than in the Netherlands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's much colder there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: You have to turn on the heating and you have to pay the energy company for that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: You have to be crazy to stay in the Netherlands. Here you can enjoy the money you would otherwise spend on gas and electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The tourism sector is eyeing up the opportunity to increase the number of foreigners coming to the region. In some cases it only costs around 50 euros to spend one night in a hotel in the low season. And flats are also getting more bookings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's clear why. All these people would otherwise lose a lot of money to heat their homes. We do not have that need in the south of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The EU has accepted Spain's so-called Iberian exception, which gives the region the ability to decouple the price of gas from electricity for a year.
